page.title: 05THE DISUSED RAILWAY LINE
page.content:
{The Disused Railway Line
The railway line was part of the main Grimsby to London King's Cross branch line which connected Spalding to Boston.It was closed in 1970.It is now overgrown with hawthorn bushes, brambles,clover,chervil and other wild flowers. There is lots of wild life such as small birds and animals hedgehogs etc, and lots of insects.It is good for nature walks, walking your dogs,a short cut on the way to school, motor bike scrambling and picking brambles.The scouts use it for compass bearing and tracking.The school often uses it for a short cut to the church or for nature walks.The children often play there.
